intro: Psychotria bukobensis, commonly known as the Bukoban Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical rainforests of East Africa, specifically Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its elliptical leaves with a glossy surface and clusters of small, white flowers. It produces small, red berries that are an important food source for various bird species. Due to its restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
